question: I knew it. He's finally retiring.
answer: I've been waiting on this day for ten thousand years.

question: If the old man picks me to take over Hell, I'll keep the torture going twenty four seven. No breaks.
answer: Well Dad says it's the breaks that make the torture. You have to let people feel a sense of relief. Then again, the beauty of Dad retiring is what he says doesn't matter anymore.

question: I'll take that. Hey, how's Daddy's little girl doing today?
answer: Good, thanks.

question: Hey. Hey. Hey. Wanna mind wrestle?
answer: Actually, I'll take a rain check on0

question: Got ya!
answer: Yes, you got me...

question: Got ya, again!
answer: Got me for sure, yes...

question: Got ya! Now here's the big finish...
answer: Oh no. Please Cassius... Aaaaah.

question: Okay, kid, we'll listen to it later. My dad, your granddad, Lucifer, was thrown out of Heaven by G-d and rules here in hell for ten thousand years. And after this ten thousand years had passed, he decided to abdicate his throne... ...to step aside. ...and let me become the ruler of hell. This, as some of you might know, is my ten thousandth year as Prince of Darkness. So I think the time has come to discuss who will succeed me.
answer: Knock, knock.

question: Yes, Jimmy. No, no, that's not what I said. He can keep his thumbs, but the fingers gotta go.
answer: Oh, and don't forget, you're shoving a pineapple up Hitler's ass at four o'clock.

question: This was a very difficult decision, because I have three wonderful sons. I mean, Adrian, so smart, so ruthless. And Cassius, so strong, so tough. And Nicky, so...so...
answer: Don't worry about coming up with anything. It's cool.

question: Such a sweet boy. But after much thought and careful consideration, I've decided that the ruler for the next ten thousand years is going to have to be...me.
answer: Hallelujah. I mean...tough break.

question: You work your ass off for ten thousand years, hurting people, helping others hurt people, then you get a decision like that.
answer: And he's dead serious.

question: It's just such a slap in the face.
answer: Um, excuse me, we're having a private conversation here.

question: Yeah, get out of here! Beat it!
answer: Twenty-thousand years ago, Grandpa Lucifer said, "It is better to rule in hell than serve in heaven." Well, I'm getting tired of serving in Hell. We need a place where we can rule.

question: Oh you wanna be a big man? Bring it on!! Let's see what you got! That's what I thought!
answer: Could you concentrate for five seconds?

question: I am concentrating. Where can we rule?
answer: What do you think about...Earth? We could create our own hell there.

question: You saying we go up there and kill everyone?
answer: Eventually, Cassius. But first we corrupt as many as we can so that when we do destroy them...

question: ...their damned souls will be ours.
answer: It's our time, brother.

question: Now that was an experience. "You are only coming through in waves." That line blows my mind every time.
answer: Definitely.

question: I don't care what kind of mood you're in at the start of that song. When it's over, that mood has been altered. Wow. Great shit. What's next?
answer: Well, I thought that after messing with your head, I'd give you a little kick in the keester.

question: Who is this, Metal-lick-a?
answer: Metallica, Dad. Come on.

question: I was just playing with you. I'm sorry. After careful consideration, I regretfully have to decline. In exchange for eternal damnation of your soul? You're too nice of a guy for me to want to do that to you, Mr. Marino. Yeah, but Joe was coming here anyways. Just go back to Earth and enjoy your records and the Hall of Fame and the beautiful family and all that. Now you're talking.
answer: You're a good devil, Dad.

question: I'm gonna die, Nicky. If the gates are broken, no new souls can get in, which means I'll start to deteriorate into nothing.
answer: What's with all the whoo-whoo noises?

question: Everything's fine, pop.
answer: Last time you said that the renaissance happened.

question: Please, pop, just go back to your room.
answer: Can I take him with me and have sex with his head?

question: We gotta get this bad boy burning again. Ideas?
answer: To do that Cassius and Adrian have to come back through the other way.

question: So go get 'em, Dad!
answer: I'm too weak. The process has already begun.

question: I got hit by a big light that was attached to a lot of metal.
answer: That's a train, son. Don't stand in front of them.

question: Well, I guess I'm going to have to take a mulligan on this one.
answer: Please, Nicky, get back up there. Try to hurry.

question: I'm Nicky.
answer: Hey, terrific!! Now get off the track and come with me, shitstains. My name's Beefy. I'm an old friend of your father's. He's asked me to help you out.

question: I just need to find my brothers and be on my way, Beefy.
answer: It's not gonna be easy. Your brothers can possess people. So they probably won't look like themselves. You have to be suspicious of everyone.

question: Okay, "bro," this jig is up... Just get in the bottle. Just slide right on in there.
answer: It's not me, moron.

question: Makin' friends already.
answer: It's freezing up here, Beefy.

question: You're on Earth now, kid. Gonna have the same physical needs and limitations a human has. We'll stop by K-mart. Get you some warm clothes.
answer: I also have this odd pain in my mid section. Kind of a hollow feeling...

question: That pain is hunger.
answer: So far, so good. Now what?

question: Put it in your mouth. Move your teeth up and down. Now you gotta swallow it. Tilt your head back and let the meat slide down your throat-hole.
answer: Hey...Popeye's chicken is ass kickin'!

question: It sure is. Now eat it up. You're gonna need your energy.
answer: I got energy up the ying-ying. Let's get cracking!

question: I got energy up the ying-ying. Let's get cracking!
answer: Hey.

question: That's a pretty brassiere.
answer: Thanks.

question: Could you maybe not tell anyone about this?
answer: You got it. Could you maybe not tell anyone about this?

question: I know exactly how you feel... The night Reagan was elected, I said to my mother, "Is this man going to blow up the world, Mommy?" Then we both cried for like an hour. Somebody's here. Call you later.
answer: Hello, friend, my name is Nicky. I understand you're seeking a roommate, as per your advertisement in the Village Voice. Would it be possible for me to fill the slot?

question: Uh, don't you want to know what the rent is?
answer: Yes. What is rent?

question: Eight-hundred, split down the middle. Tuesdays and Thursdays I rehearse with my scene partner so the living room will be off limits.
answer: Off limits.

question: Right. And as far as household items
answer: No.

question: It's like eighty degrees in this hallway. You from the South?
answer: Yeah. The deep South.

question: Why is that funny?
answer: I don't know.

question: Oh, this is delicious.
answer: "Let the sin begins" - that was a good one.

question: Well, we must get people sinning if we want to fill up our New Hell. How are things going down at City Hall?
answer: I lowered the drinking age to ten.

question: Brilliant. This is so much fun. I never want it to end.
answer: Why should it end? Who's gonna stop us?

question: This is intense! And it happens every day? Sometimes twice? I gotta tip my hat to you people!
answer: Look, it's okay for me to shit the street. But you gotta use a toilet.

question: Okay, just point me in the right direction next time.
answer: Come on, there's like ten million people in this city and the clock is ticking.

question: Sounds like our devil dance actually worked this time.
answer: 'Bout time... There's our man.

question: Mr. Sleepyhead must have some major ties to the dark side.
answer: What's with that guy?

question: Gotta be one of his disciples or something.
answer: Yo, man, I think that devil guy just got ripped off.

question: Should we wake him up?
answer: Yeah. You do it.

question: Hey...
answer: See something you like, my man?

question: Yes. I would like my flask back.
answer: You callin' me a thief, my man?

question: No, I'm just calling you... a guy who has my flask.
answer: And if that is your so-called "flask," how would I have it unless I was, in fact, a thief?

question: I don't know?
answer: Well, that's a very special item. The cap itself is one hundred percent plappium. It's a value is over three thousand dollars.

question: It was handcrafted in hell by Satan himself and is only to be used for the capture and containment of my blood brothers so that the firefall of Hades will burn brightly once again.
answer: Okay, now you gone and done it. You done messed with my business bitch!

question: Sir, I would prefer if you didn't raise your voice. It's making my muscles tighten.
answer: Oh, you gonna go all crazy eyes on me? I'll show you some crazy eyes. Let's get busy.

question: Oh, you gonna go all crazy eyes on me? I'll show you some crazy eyes. Let's get busy.
answer: Excuse me, does that flask belong to this man?

question: Now you callin' me a thief? Damn.
answer: Look, I know you come out here and sell stolen stuff all the time. But today, the guy you stole from just happened to walk by and bust you. So why don't you admit today's not your day and give him his flask back?

question: Or what're you gonna do about it? Ugly me to death?
answer: No, but maybe that cop over there might have something to say.

question: Aw, take your dumb-ass canteen, goofy. And you, take your raggedy-ass clothes and find a new corner. Before I show you what real crazy is.
answer: Fine. I will.

question: Fine. I will.
answer: Hey, mister. I'll be seeing you in a few years. That was amazing. Thanks so much. You didn't have to do that.

question: That's okay. I get messed with all the time and when I saw him doing that to you I just lost it. I hate when people take advantage of tourists. It ruins it for the rest of us.
answer: You think I'm a tourist?

question: I'm sorry. I just assumed. Your accent maybe. Where are you from?
answer: The South.

question: Really?
answer: Yeah. Deep south.

question: Why are you laughing?
answer: I don't know, but I like it. Say. Your glasses are nice. They make your eyes look sparkly and big. It's fun to look at them.

question: My dad's an optometrist.
answer: My dad's in hell, and he's falling apart.

question: I'm sorry. It's really tough when your parents get older.
answer: If I don't save him, I don't know what I'm gonna do.

question: Well, I'm sure a nice southern boy like you will figure something out.
answer: Here, have a Popeye's. This drumstick ain't for beatin' it's for eatin'.

question: That's alright. I already ate lunch. I actually wouldn't mind getting a Gelati.
answer: Could I come with you to getting a Gelati?

question: If you want to.
answer: Want to? A million angry octopus people couldn't hold me back!

question: "Octopus people?"
answer: Uh, it's a deep south expression. It's freezing my hands.

question: I'd love to have a dog. But I go to school full time. It wouldn't be fair to the dog.
answer: School?

question: Parsons School of Design. I knew growing up I wasn't much to look at, so I put my energy into making things that are pretty.
answer: What's that pleasant smell coming from, your skin?

question: My perfume? It's called "Comptoir Sud Pacific." Which I think is the French word for coconuts.
answer: Valerie, it feels like there's a bunch of butterflies flapping around in my stomach. Is that normal?

question: Sometimes, sure.
answer: Good. I was concerned.

question: Doesn't sound very good behind there. I hope Nicky's kicking some ass on Earth.
answer: You know, I was the one who created Hell.

question: I know, your wickedness.
answer: I started slow, though. For years, I was just giving people hot foots. Actually, you can give all the credit for Hell to my first wife; she was the inspiration. She was an ugly one, too. One day, she asked me if I wanted super sex. I said I'll take the soup. Take it easy there, Chewbacca. In fact, you look like her mother, except she had more hair. You know what was in Hell when I came down here, Cassius?

question: It's Stanley, sir.
answer: Nothing. No mountains. No castles. Looked like a giant parking lot. It wasn't even called Hell.

question: What was it called, sir.
answer: Boogerland!

question: That's nice, Grandpa. Why don't you just enjoy the fishing?
answer: I can't enjoy anything. I go fishing. I catch nothing. I go to orgies, I catch everything...

question: So you're saying, make all pants with a drawstring, then heavier set gals don't have to feel humiliated by telling their waist size in front of the whole store?
answer: Basically, yeah.

question: Wow. Maybe you should make drawstring socks for gals with fat ankles.
answer: You know what's nice about you? You just seem happy being yourself. You don't try to act cool.

question: Thanks much. You know what's nice about you, Valerie?
answer: What?

question: Your juicy, heart-shaped ass.
answer: What was that?

question: I...I don't know why I just said that. I meant to say that... ...I've always wanted to have sex with a gross pig. What do you say we go behind that dumpster, pull our pants down and see what happens?
answer: You're a jerk.

question: Adrian, you gotta come back to Hell. Dad's sick.
answer: He's sick?

question: Yeah, he needs souls to live. When you guys left, you broke the gates. We gotta get the gates burning again before he dies.
answer: He should have thought of that before he denied me my birthright.

question: Well maybe you should go back and talk it over with him.
answer: How about this? I stay here enjoying my Schnapps and you go back.

question: Your brothers are upsetting the balance of good and evil.
answer: What can I do about it?

question: You can't do jack shit... unless you learn your evil powers.
answer: Nobody's as evil as my brothers. Those dudes put the wick in wicked.

question: Go get a soda out of the fridge.
answer: But those are my roommate's sodas...

question: "But those are my roommate's sodas..." Does that sound like a statement the son of the devil would make? You have the power to change the cola in that can into any other liquid - engine oil, bat's blood, moose piss. You just have to release the evil within you.
answer: Release the evil?

question: Todd. Which way to the Parson's School of Design? Coconuts...
answer: Hello.

question: You smell like coconuts.
answer: It's "Comptoir Sud Pacific." Makes me feel like a hula girl. Which is kinda what I'm going for. Wanna come in?

question: No thanks. I'm looking for a girl named Valerie who also smells like coconuts.
answer: Valerie Doran? Two floors up, one window over.

question: Thanks, much. Good luck with the genital tucking.
answer: I don't need luck. I'm good.

question: Adrian?
answer: Andrew.

question: Hey.
answer: Nicky? Oh my G-d. Stay right there.

question: Oh that stings! My eyes are on fire!
answer: What were you thinking coming here?

question: I'm not sure, but it didn't involve getting blinded with poison.
answer: Oh my G-d, I'm so sorry! Nicky?

question: Valerie?
answer: Are you dead?

question: No.
answer: What are you doing?

question: I think I'm floating.
answer: Why would you be floating?

question: I don't know. Maybe it's because of your sweet voice.
answer: Am I supposed to not be freaked out right now? Because I am.

question: Oh. Sorry, Andrew. Valerie?
answer: I'm over here, Nicky! To the left. Look, just because you're floating doesn't mean I'm gonna forget about you giving me the finger.

question: That wasn't me. I was being possessed by my brother, Adrian. He's the one who call you a gross pig.
answer: What do you mean, "possessed?"

question: Remember when I told you my Dad was in Hell?
answer: Yes...

question: Well, that's because he's the Devil. And he wants to keep his throne for another ten-thousand years. Which is fine with me, but not with my brothers, so they broke out of Hell, causing my dad...
answer: ... "The Devil?"...

question: ...to decompose. And I love my Dad very much. So I came to Earth to save him but then crazy eyes stole my flask and I met you and...well, my dog tells me I just might be in love with you.
answer: Okay, now I get that "deep south" joke. I don't know if I should believe you.

question: You gotta believe me. You gotta believe in the butterflies.
answer: Okay, I do. Get back up here. This is amazing.

question: Can we go fly over Central Park?
answer: Next time. Tonight, I want to share the most beautiful thing I could possibly imagine.

question: We're going to Jersey?
answer: East Rutherford. I never thought I'd ever see Ozzy live until he was dead. Please tell me you like metal.

question: "Mister Crowley, what's inside of your head..."
answer: My dog was right. I'm in love with you. Moo ya san jie bay!

question: Beat it, ya freak.
answer: Schnapps...

question: Peppermint...alright.
answer: Wanna hit?

question: And give you a good buzz.
answer: Or maybe it will trap me inside for all eternity.

question: Uh. No it won't?
answer: Oh, Nicky, I've missed you. Come on out and say hello...

question: Urr...uggg...errr...
answer: I'm calling you out, brother... Hello, Cassius.

question: I'm calling you out, brother... Hello, Cassius.
answer: All right. Let me out.

question: You know, New Hell really only needs one new Satan.
answer: You mother...

question: The home of eternal damnation, house of Hades, H.E. double toothpicks...
answer: Maybe try the opposite of that. Okay, can I just ask you something? What do you know about your mom?

question: My brothers told me my mother was a mountain goat. Which would explain my chronic halitosis.
answer: A mountain goat? That's really sweet.

question: My mom wasn't a goat?
answer: Try an angel.

question: An angel?
answer: Unh-huh. Which would make you half angel.

question: Wow. What...what did she look like?
answer: Well, she was about six-three, only spoke Portuguese and had really long grey hair. I'm sorry, I'm totally busting on you. I'm your mom.

question: Somebody explain what's going on.
answer: You'll get nothing out of me.

question: Perhaps a titty twister will loosen your lips.
answer: The only way to save your dad is for you and your brothers to pass through the gates at the same time before he deteriorates completely.

question: How much time does Dad have before that happens?
answer: Thirty minutes. And then whoever claims his throne will have unimaginable power.

question: But I don't know, he was funny, he made me laugh, and I hate to say it but he had a really nice body.
answer: And that made you want to make a baby with him?

question: Well, I really wasn't thinking about making a baby at the time! Hello....yes, he's here with me now... I don't know if he's hot, he's my son, you perv! I'll call you back... Oh my G-d, I will call you back, goodbye. That was my friend, Michelle, she says "hi."
answer: Well tell her I said "hi" back.

question: But how can I win? Adrian is stronger and smarter than me.
answer: Stronger, yes. Smarter, definitely. But you have something he doesn't have.

question: A speech impediment?
answer: No, you have the inner light. You can totally use it. It's the best power of all. And in case you get in real bad trouble, G-d told me to give you this.

question: What is it?
answer: I'm not a hundred percent on that. G-d said when the time comes, you'll know what to do.

question: Well, goodbye...for now. Can I just do this? That was such a Mom thing, wasn't it?
answer: Well, nice meeting you, Jenna, Christa. Would it be okay if I called you Mommy?

question: It would be so okay.
answer: Well, Mommy, get me to the big apple cause I'm gonna rock that town like a hurricane.

question: You're already there...
answer: Release...the good. Release the good... Release the awesome. Put it in your mouth and let it slide down your throat-hole.

question: Little Nicky.
answer: Adrian, I'm asking you nicely, in the name of all that is good

question: Is this a joke?
answer: No. It's the inner light. And with it we can defeat anything you've got. Okay, Adrian, you've left me with no choice. Love lifts me up where I belong.

question: Sole ruler of Hell and Earth is what I heard him keep saying.
answer: Nicky!

question: That was Cassius!
answer: Where'd a sweet Southern boy learn to fight like that?

question: You came through, Nicky.
answer: I came through for you, Mom and the butterflies, Dad.

question: You're back in Hell now, kid. There's no butterflies here. If you want butterflies, you need to be on Earth.
answer: What about you and Grandpa and everyone in Hell?
